title: The Missing Necklace
description: A valuable family heirloom has disappeared from a locked room. Can you find the culprit?
author: Sherlock AI

nodes.content: You've been called to the Blackwood Manor to investigate the disappearance of a valuable diamond necklace. Lady Eleanor Blackwood reports that her family heirloom was stolen from her bedroom safe last night.
You examine the safe carefully. It appears undamaged, with no signs of forced entry. The safe requires both a key and a combination to open.
nodes.evidence: The safe shows no signs of forced entry, suggesting either the combination was known or a key was used.

nodes.content: Lady Eleanor is visibly upset. 'The necklace has been in my family for generations! I wore it at the dinner party last night, then placed it in the safe before going to bed. When I checked this morning, it was gone!'
The butler, James, appears nervous. 'I was serving at the dinner party last night, and then retired to my quarters at 11 PM. I didn't hear anything unusual during the night.'
'We had four guests last night - my nephew Thomas, my friend Victoria, the local doctor, and Thomas's fianc√©e Rebecca. They all left around 10 PM.'
'Only I know the combination. The safe requires both the combination and a key, which I keep on my nightstand.'
nodes.evidence: Lady Eleanor keeps the safe key on her nightstand overnight.

nodes.content: 'I suppose someone could have watched me open it. I did open the safe to put away some jewelry before the dinner party while my maid was helping me dress.'
nodes.evidence: Lady Eleanor opened the safe before the dinner party while her maid was present.

nodes.content: 'Martha has been with me for years! I trust her completely. Although... she did recently mention needing money for her mother's medical treatments.'
nodes.evidence: The maid, Martha, needs money for family medical expenses.

nodes.content: Martha appears nervous when questioned. 'Yes, I was helping Lady Eleanor before the party. I would never take the necklace! I've been loyal to this family for 15 years!'
'Yes, my mother needs an expensive operation. But I would never steal! Lady Eleanor has been very generous with advances on my salary.'
Martha hesitates. 'I was in my room all night after helping Lady Eleanor to bed at 11 PM.' Her eyes dart to the side as she speaks.
nodes.evidence: Martha seems to be lying about her whereabouts last night.

nodes.content: 'Nothing specific, sir. Although... I did see Martha, the maid, walking in the gardens very late. Must have been around midnight. She normally never leaves the house at night.'
nodes.evidence: The butler saw Martha walking outside at midnight, contradicting her statement.

nodes.content: 'I've served the family for twenty years. Lady Eleanor has always treated me fairly.'

When confronted with the butler's testimony, Martha breaks down. 'Fine! I took it! My mother will die without that operation, and I was desperate! The necklace is hidden in a hollow book in the library.'

You recover the necklace from the library and return it to Lady Eleanor. Martha confesses to the theft but explains her desperate circumstances. Lady Eleanor, moved by Martha's plight, decides not to press charges and instead offers to pay for her mother's medical treatment.
This investigation is complete. Would you like to try another case?
